questList.ask: When ventilating a patient with a pulse, you should squeeze the bag every  _______  seconds for an adult and every  _______  seconds for a child.

feedback.info: When ventilating a patient with a pulse, you should squeeze the bag every 5 to 6 seconds for an adult and every 3 to 5 seconds for a child.
feedback.location: Normal respiration rate for an ADULT at rest is 12 to 16 breaths per minute for a CHILD 12 to 20 breaths per minute.

questList.ask: The pressure or gas a full oxygen cylinder is approximately  _______  psi.

feedback.info: The pressure of gas in a full oxygen cylinder is approximately 2,000 psi.

questList.ask: You encounter a four-month-old baby in cardiac arrest with unknown cause. What type of defibrillator would be most preferred?
options: A defibrillator is not recommended for infants less than one year old.

feedback.info: A manual defibrillator is preferred for an infant less than one year old

questList.ask: What should you do when assessing a responsive adult patient with possible cardiac compromise?
options: Check vitals and ventilate the patient
Attach and apply and AED immediately.

feedback.info: Apply high concentration oxygen when assessing a responsive adult patient with possible cardiac compromise.

questList.ask: ROSC Has been achieved in a patient. What does this mean?

feedback.info: ROSC Has been achieved when if a patient has regained consciousness

questList.ask: What percentage oxygen does a BVM (bag valve mask) deliver, when it is not attached to oxygen?

feedback.info: A BVM delivers 21% oxygen when it is not attached to oxygen

questList.ask: A patient has an open abdominal wound and their organs are protruding. You should:
options: Cover with a sterile saline moistened gauze and secure with am occlusive dressing.
Immediately apply a pressure dressing over a sterile gauze.
Cover with a sterile moistened gauze and seal with a pressure dressing

feedback.info: A patient with an abdominal wound and protruding organs should have the wound covered with a sterile saline moistened gauze and secured with an occlusive dressing.
